page.title: 01GEOGRAPHY HOLDERNESS SOUTH
page.content: { LOCAL AREA}We are near the southern tip of what was the East Riding of Yorkshire.It is a low, flat area, which separates the cold North Sea from the mighty River Humber. { GEOLOGY }The underlying rock is mainly thick clay which was deposited by an ancient Scandinavian Glacier. Evidence for this can be found on a local beach where Norwegian rocks can be found washed out from the cliffs. { FARMING }This clay is very fertile and is used for arable farming.The main crops are wheat,barley,oats,and rape.Farming is our main industry. { EMPLOYMENT}The other main occupations are North Sea Gas extraction and tourism. { ISOLATION}We are an isolated area and have our own dialect and customs.
